metaData.descriptionCS: The examinee responds orally to items that require manipulation of the sounds within words.

questions.title: Sample A. sunshine
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

What word do you make when you put sun...shine together? Gradually reduce the pause between the parts: Sun..shine. Sun.shine. (Pause for response.) Sun…shine makes the word sunshine. Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Note: In Phonological Processing, when reading target words in parts, with each part separated by ellipses (...), pause 1 second between parts of the word.

I will say a word one part at a time. Listen carefully, and then put the parts together to make a whole word. Ready? Sun...shine. (Pause about 1 second between the parts of the word.) What is the word?

Optional puppet instructions: Introduce the puppet by saying, This is Pepper. Pepper says words in pieces. Pepper will say a word one part at a time. Listen carefully, and then put the parts together to make a whole word. Ready? Sun...shine. (Pause about 1 second between the parts of the word.) What is the word?

questions.title: â€ Item 1. mother
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

What word do you make when you put muh...ther together? Gradually reduce the pause between the parts: Muh..ther. Muh.ther. (Pause for response.) Muh...ther makes the word mother. Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Listen carefully: muh…ther. What is the word?

questions.title: Item 2. cupcake
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Ready? Listen.

cup...cake

questions.title: Item 3. telephone
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Ready? Listen.

tel...uh...phone

questions.title: Item 4. surprise
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Ready? Listen.

sur...prise

questions.title: Item 5. basketball
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Ready? Listen.

bas...ket...ball

questions.title: Item 6. wall
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Now I will say a word in smaller parts. Listen carefully, and then put the parts together to make a whole word. Ready? (Pause for response.)

/w/...aw.../l/

Optional puppet instructions: Say, Now Pepper will say a word in smaller parts. Listen carefully, and then put the parts together to make a whole word. Ready? (Pause for response.)

/w/...aw.../l/

questions.title: Item 7. laugh
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Ready? Listen.

/l/.../a/.../f/

questions.title: Item 8. glad
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Ready? Listen.

/g/.../l/.../a/.../d/

questions.title: Item 9. stretch
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Ready? Listen.

/s/.../t/.../r/.../e/...ch

questions.title: Item 10. agreement
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Ready? Listen.

uh.../g/.../r/...ee.../m/.../e/.../n/.../t/

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This section of the subtest discontinues after 3 consecutive scores of 0 points.

questions.title: Sample B. hat
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

One of them doesn’t sound like the others. Listen again: bee...knee...hat. Bee and knee rhyme, but hat sounds different. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Point to each picture as you say its name. Pause about 1 second between each word.

I will say three words. Two of them rhyme, but one doesn’t. Which one doesn’t rhyme with the others? Listen: bee (point)...knee (point)...hat (point).

questions.title: â€ Item 11. horse
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

Listen again: dog...log...horse. Dog and log rhyme, but horse sounds different. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
â€‹

Which one doesn’t rhyme with the others? 

Listen: dog...log...horse (point to each).

questions.title: Item 12. map
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Which one doesn’t rhyme with the others? Listen: goat...map...coat (point to each).

questions.title: Item 13. book
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Which one doesn’t rhyme with the others? 

Point to each picture as you say its name: fan...book...man

questions.title: Sample C. hat
questions.correctInstructionsHTML:
Correct response [Any word or nonword besides hat that ends with the sound /at/ (e.g., bat, sat, gat)]:

That’s right. You can say a real word or a made-up word. Let’s try another one.
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

Bat rhymes with hat. So does sat. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Cat and zat rhyme with hat. What’s another word that rhymes with hat?

1.conditionalText: Any real word or nonword response besides "hat" that rhymes with the sound /at/.

questions.title: â€ Item 14. see
questions.correctInstructionsHTML:
Correct response [Any word or nonword besides see that ends with the sound /ee/ (e.g., bee, he, ree)]:

Continue administration.
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

Bee rhymes with see. So does he. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say a word that rhymes with see.

1.conditionalText: Any word or nonword besides "see" that ends with the sound /ee/.

questions.title: Item 15. mad
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Say a word that rhymes with...

mad

questions.title: Item 16. money
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Say a word that rhymes with...

money

questions.title: Item 17. fur
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Say a word that rhymes with...

fur

questions.title: Item 18. lime
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Use the following prompt as needed: Say a word that rhymes with...

lime

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This section of the subtest discontinues after 3 consecutive scores of 0 points.

questions.title: Sample D. hat (net)
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

Net ends with the same sound as hat. Listen: net...hat. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
For each item, point to each picture as you say its name, and pause about 1 second between each word.

Emphasize the final sound of each stimulus word by either lengthening the final sound (e.g., treeee) or exaggerating it (e.g., hat).

Point to the picture of the hat and say, This is a hat. One of these (gesture to the other pictures in the row) ends with the same sound as hat. Which one is it? Listen. Point to each picture as you say, pin...net...head. Which one ends with the same sound as hat?

questions.title: â€ Item 19. whistle (pencil)
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

Pencil ends with the same sound as whistle. Listen: whistle...pencil. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Point to the picture of the whistle and say, This is a whistle. One of these (gesture to the other pictures in the row) ends with the same sound as whistle. Which one is it? Listen. Point to each picture as you say, bunny (/ee/)...pencil…cup. Which one ends with the same sound as whistle?

questions.title: Item 20. dress (bus)
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Which of these ends with the same sound as dress?

bus...rope...pot (point to each)

questions.title: Item 21. pig (log)
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Which of these ends with the same sound as pig?

bed...sock...logÌ² (point to each)

questions.title: Item 22. trash (fish)
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Which of these ends with the same sound as trash?

fish...drum...tree (point to each)

questions.title: Item 23. beak (sock)
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Which of these ends with the same sound as beak?

sock...frogÌ²...bed (point to each)

questions.title: Item 24. stamp (sheep)
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
Which of these ends with the same sound as stamp?

star...ant...sheep (point to each)

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This section of the subtest discontinues after 3 consecutive scores of 0 points.

questions.title: Sample E. near â€“ /n/
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

If you take away /n/ from near, what’s left is ear. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: I’ll say a word, and you say it back to me. Near. (Pause for response.) Now say near, but don’t say /n/.

questions.title: Sample F. plate â€“ /t/
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

If you take away /t/ from plate, what’s left is play. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say plate. (Pause for response.) Now say plate, but don’t say /t/.

questions.title: â€ Item 25. cried â€“ /d/
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

If you take away /d/ from cried, what’s left is cry. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say cried. (Pause for response.) Now say cried, but don’t say /d/.

questions.title: Item 26. ice â€“ /s/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say ice. (Pause for response.) Now say ice, but don’t say /s/.

questions.title: Item 27. hat â€“ /h/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say hat. (Pause for response.) Now say hat, but don’t say /h/.

questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say smell. (Pause for response.) Now say smell, but don’t say /m/.

questions.title: Item 29. floor â€“ /l/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say floor. (Pause for response.) Now say floor, but don’t say /l/.

questions.title: Item 30. wives â€“ /v/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say wives. (Pause for response.) Now say wives, but don’t say /v/.

questions.title: Item 31. swamp â€“ /m/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say swamp. (Pause for response.) Now say swamp, but don’t say /m/.

questions.title: Item 32. hopped â€“ /p/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say hopped. (Pause for response.) Now say hopped, but don’t say /p/.

questions.title: Item 33. squat â€“ /k/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say squat. (Pause for response.) Now say squat, but don’t say /k/.

questions.title: Item 34. quip â€“ /k/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say quip. (Pause for response.) Now say quip, but don’t say /k/.

questions.title: Item 35. text â€“ /k/
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say text. (Pause for response.) Now say text, but don’t say /k/.

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This section of the subtest discontinues after 3 consecutive scores of 0 points.

questions.title: Sample G. sunshine
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

Say sun…shine. (Pause for response.) Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML:
I’ll say a word, and you say it back to me. Sunshine. (Pause for response.) Good. Now let’s say the word in parts. If the word is sunshine, you should say, sun…shine. (Pause about 1 second between the parts.) Try it. Say sunshine one part at a time.

Optional puppet instructions: Say, Now put Pepper on your hand. You’re going to make Pepper talk. I’ll say a word, and then you make Pepper say it in pieces. Modify the instructions to ask how Pepper says each target word. For example, replace Say sunshine one part at a time with How does Pepper say sunshine one part at a time?

questions.title: â€ Item 36. doorknob
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

If the word is doorknob, you should say, door...knob. Try it. Say door...knob. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say doorknob. (Pause for response.) Now say doorknob one part at a time.

questions.title: Item 37. birdhouse
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say birdhouse. (Pause for response.) Now say birdhouse one part at a time.

questions.title: Item 38. picnic
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say picnic. (Pause for response.) Now say picnic one part at a time.

questions.title: â€ Item 39. banana
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

If the word is banana, you should say, buh…nan…uh. Try it. Say buh…nan…uh. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say banana. (Pause for response.) Now say banana one part at a time.

questions.title: Item 40. calculation
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say calculation. (Pause for response.) Now say calculation one part at a time.

questions.title: Sample H. at
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

If the word is at, you should say, a…t. Try it. Say a…t. Teach further as needed, and then say, Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Now let’s say words in smaller parts, one sound at a time. Say at. (Pause for response.) Good. If the word is at, you should say, a…t (pause about 1 second between the parts). Try it. Say at one sound at a time.

questions.title: â€ Item 41. go
questions.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect or no response:

If the word is go, you should say, g…oh. Try it. Say g…oh. Teach further as needed, and then say,
Let’s try another one.
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say go. (Pause for response.) Now say go one sound at a time.

questions.title: Item 42. is
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say is. (Pause for response.) Now say is one sound at a time.

questions.title: Item 43. cat
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say cat. (Pause for response.) Now say cat one sound at a time.

questions.topInstructionsHTML: Say bath. (Pause for response.) Now say bath one sound at a time.
